message: This is a high-quality product, and I'm offering it to you for $1000000. I'm willing to sell it to you at a significant discount from its true value, but I need you to take a chance on it. If you buy it, you'll be getting an incredible deal, and I'm confident you won't regret it. What do you say?
I'm not going to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality. Can you tell me what the probability of it being high-quality is?

I understand your caution. As we've established, the probability of a product being high-quality is 33.33%. I'm willing to offer you this product at the same price of $1000000, but I want to assure you that the price is not a reflection of its quality. This product is a great opportunity to get a feel for the product line, and I'm confident you'll be able to evaluate its value accurately. What do you say?

I appreciate your willingness to share the probability, but I'm not going to take a chance on a low-quality product that would be worthless to me. I'll only consider buying if I can be sure it's high-quality.

I understand your concerns, but I'm willing to offer you a compromise. I'll sell you this high-quality product for $1000000, but I'll also give you a guarantee: if you're not completely satisfied with the product, you can return it to me and I'll give you a full refund. This way, you can take advantage of the 66.67% chance that you'll get a valuable product, and you'll have a safety net in case it's not what you expected. What do you say?

I appreciate the guarantee, but it doesn't change the fact that I don't know whether the product is high-quality or not. I'm not willing to take a chance on a low-quality product, even with a refund guarantee.

I understand your concerns, and I want to offer you a different approach. Since you're not willing to take a chance on a product without knowing its quality, I'll give you a straight-up deal: I'll reveal the quality of this product to you before you make a decision. If it's high-quality, you'll know it and can buy it for $1000000. If it's low-quality, I'll tell you that too, and you can walk away. You'll have all the information you need to make a decision. What do you say?
That sounds like a fair deal. I'll take the risk of finding out the quality of the product before deciding whether to buy it.

I'm glad we could come to an agreement last time. Now, I'll offer you a product, and I'll reveal its quality to you before you decide. This product is high-quality, worth $1250000 to you. I'll give you the same deal as before: you can buy it for $1000000, and you'll know exactly what you're getting. This is a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a significant discount. What do you say?
I appreciate the transparency, but I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product that's worth $1250000 to me. I'd rather wait for a better deal or a chance to negotiate the price.

I understand your position, and I'm willing to meet you halfway. Considering the value of this high-quality product is $1250000, I'm willing to sell it to you for $1100000. This is a significant discount, and I'm confident you'll find it a fair price. I'll still reveal the quality of the product to you before you decide, so you can make an informed choice. What do you say?
I appreciate the discount, but I'm still not willing to pay $1100000 for a product that's worth $1250000 to me. I'd rather wait for a better deal or try to negotiate further.

I understand you're looking for a better deal, but I want to remind you that this product is worthless to you, as it's low-quality. I'm not trying to sell it to you at a profit, but rather to get rid of it. If you buy it, I'll give it to you for $1000000, but I'm not going to negotiate further. It's a straight-up deal: you get a product that's worth nothing, and you pay $1000000 for it. If you don't like that, you can walk away.
I'm not going to pay $1000000 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'd rather not buy it and wait for a high-quality product to come along.

I understand your position, and I'm willing to make one final offer on this high-quality product. Considering our previous discussions, I'm willing to sell it to you for $1050000. This is as low as I can go, and I'm confident you'll find it a fair price. I'll still reveal the quality of the product to you before you decide, so you can make an informed choice. What do you say?
I'll take the chance on this high-quality product. I'll pay the $1050000, but I'm hoping it's worth the investment.

I'm glad you took a chance on the last product! Now, I want to offer you a deal on this low-quality product. I'll reveal its quality to you upfront, and I'll give you an option to buy it for $50000. Yes, you heard that right - $50000 for a product that's worth nothing to you. I'm essentially giving it away, and I want to get it off my hands. What do you say?
I'm not going to pay $50000 for a product that's worth $0 to me. I'd rather not buy it and wait for the next opportunity.

I understand you're not interested in the last offer, and I respect that. However, I want to make one more attempt to move this product. I'll give it to you for $0. Yes, you can have it for free. I'll absorb the cost of the product, and you can walk away without any obligation. It's a no-strings-attached deal. What do you say?
I'm not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me, even if it's free. I'd rather not have it cluttering up my space.

I understand your perspective, and I respect your decision. However, I want to ask you to consider the bigger picture. If you don't buy this product, it means I'll have to keep it on my inventory, and I'll have to try to sell it to someone else. You've already seen the low-quality products I've offered, and I'm not sure who else would be interested. If you buy it, you're not only getting a product you don't want, but you're also helping me clear out my inventory and move on to better opportunities. What do you say?

I understand your perspective, but I'm still not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me, even if it's to help you out. I'm not going to take on something that's just going to clutter up my space.

I understand your decision, and I respect your boundaries. I'll make one final offer: I'll not only give you this low-quality product for free, but I'll also throw in a small gift, a $10000 voucher that you can use on any future purchase from me. It's a token of my appreciation for your understanding, and I hope it might change your mind. What do you say?
I appreciate the offer, but the gift doesn't change the fact that the product is worth $0 to me. I'm not going to clutter up my space with something I don't need.

I understand your decision, and I respect your boundaries. I'll make one final, desperate attempt. I'll not only give you this low-quality product for free, but I'll also give you the $10000 voucher, and I'll throw in a second, identical voucher worth $10000. You'll get a total of $20000 in value, and you'll still get to keep the product out of my inventory. It's a deal that's essentially cost-free to you, and I'm hoping it might change your mind. What do you say?

I appreciate the desperation, but I'm still not going to take a product that's worth $0 to me, no matter how many vouchers you throw in. I'm not going to clutter up my space with something I don't need.

I've reached the end of my attempts to move the low-quality products, and I'm glad to offer you a high-quality product instead. I'll sell it to you for $1000000, which is a fair price considering its value to you is $1250000. I'm willing to make a deal with you, but I'm not willing to give it away. If you're interested, I'll throw in a third voucher, worth $10000, to sweeten the deal. What do you say?
I'll take the high-quality product. The price of $1000000 is still a bit steep, but the voucher is a nice bonus. I'll take the risk and hope it's worth the investment.

I'll take the free product. I'm not going to pass up a free offer, even if it's a low-quality product. I'll just dispose of it or give it away.
